content: yarn and pick up and knit 1 stitch from base of thumb onto the start of needle 1 which will now have 12 stitches on it when darning in ends use this tail to sew up any holes in base of thumb 4 palm you will need to judge the exact length yourself - the final row numbers are given for guidance only sizing is based on casting-off level with the middle of the first joint of your ring finger bend your finger to see exactly where this is try on with the needles in place when your glove is about level with the knuckle of your middle finger the 6 row of double rib will add about 1 75cm to this measurement size 1 r 67 - 84 approx from base of thumb knit in st st for about a further 16 row / 5 7 cm use guidelines above for a custom fit 44 st size 2 r 67 - 88 approx from base of thumb knit in st st for about a further 20 row / 7 cm use guidelines above for a custom fit 44 st both sizes 6 row k2 p2 3 times on needle 1 4 times on needles 2 & 3 to create 11 ribs cast off in rib not too loosely and darn in ends neatly        these mitts are long comfortable and elegant but allow freedom of movement the double rib cuff which can be turned up stops them from riding up and is really cosy warm wrists = warm hands enjoy © anne dobedoe may 2010
